title: Spinach, Lentil, and Rice Soup
introduction: Spinach, Lentil, and Rice Soup is a comforting and nutritious dish that combines tender lentils with fresh spinach and hearty rice. This soup offers a rich, earthy flavor enhanced by garlic and extra-virgin olive oil, making it a perfect meal for cold days.
ingredients: 1 pound lentils, picked over and rinsed
8 ounces spinach, stemmed and torn into bite-size pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.description: In a large pot, combine the lentils, water, garlic, and oil. Bring to a simmer and cook over low heat 40 minutes. Add a little water as needed so that the lentils are just covered.
Stir in the spinach and the salt and pepper to taste. Cook until the lentils are tender, about 10 minutes more.
Add the rice and cook until heated through. Serve hot, with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil.

variations: If less water is added and the rice is omitted, this soup becomes a side dish to serve with grilled fish fillets or pork.
Escarole, kale, cabbage, Swiss chard, or other leafy greens can be used instead of the spinach.
